FuncDef:
The link-protocol transport eoam3ah command enables an interface to transparently transmit untagged Ethernet OAM 802.3ah packets.
The undo link-protocol transport eoam3ah command restores the default configuration.
By default, an interface is not enabled to transparently transmit untagged Ethernet OAM 802.3ah packets.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, an interface bound to a VLAN, VSI, or EVPN instance drops untagged Ethernet OAM 802.3ah packets. If you want the interface to transparently transmit untagged Ethernet OAM 802.3ah packets, run the link-protocol transport eoam3ah command. The interface then forwards these protocol packets as normal packets.
